summary: This document is a real estate settlement package for the sale of a 156-acre property at 338 East Washington Road, Bradford, New Hampshire, from the Richard Yospin Family Trust to Granite Reality, LLC for $1,070,750.00. It includes a HUD-1 Settlement Statement, Warranty Deed, and New Hampshire tax forms, with the transaction closing on December 13, 2019. This document is a real estate transaction closing package for the sale of a property in Bradford, NH, from the Richard Yospin Family Trust to Granite Reality LLC for $1,070,750.00. It includes tax declarations, affidavits, title insurance documents, and wire transfer records, showing the involvement of attorneys, a real estate agent, and a title company.

keyFacts: Granite Reality, LLC purchased a 156-acre property in Bradford, New Hampshire for $1,070,750.00 on December 13, 2019.
The seller was Richard Yospin, as Trustee of The Richard Yospin Family Trust.
The transaction involved significant settlement charges, including over $58,000 in fees and over $8,000 in New Hampshire real estate transfer tax.
The legal and tax paperwork was prepared by Rebecca Russo of Hudkins Law PLLC.
The property's legal description references adjacent landowners including Neff, Weld D. Proctor, Penhallow Forest Corp., and Rial Rowe.
Granite Reality LLC, managed by Jeffrey W. Roberts, purchased a property in Bradford, NH, from the Richard Yospin Family Trust (Richard Yospin, Trustee) for $1,070,750.00 on December 13, 2019.
The transaction involved a wire transfer of $994,279.12 from Granite Reality LLC on December 12, 2019, and the property was subject to 'Current Use Taxation' which restricts development.
The law firm Hudkins Law PLLC, with processor Rebecca Russo, handled the closing, and the title insurance was provided by Stewart Title Guaranty Company.
The real estate agents involved were Margaret Weathers (listing agent for seller) and Jennifer Johnson (buyer's agent), both with Four Seasons Sotheby's International Realty.
The seller certified that the Richard Yospin Family Trust is not a foreign entity for U.S. tax purposes and that there were no outstanding mortgages on the property.
